text: Which of the following devices is not a micro computer?
The main difference between a laptop and a desktop is that, a laptop?

options.A: does not have mouse while a desktop has
options.B: uses USB port while desktop uses parallel port
options.C: can be connected to the internet while desktop cannot
options.D: contains high capacity battery that powers for extensive period while desktop has not.

explanation: The main difference between a laptop and a desktop is that a laptop contains a high-capacity battery that powers it for an extensive period while a desktop does not. Both laptops and desktops can use a mouse, have USB and parallel ports, and can be connected to the internet.

text: Abacus is used for?
explanation: Abacus is a tool that can be used to calculate —Add,Subtract,Multiply & divide, apart from being able to do other arithmetic functions and Brain activation. However, the basic use of Abacus is for addition and subtraction.

text: The computer hardware is made up of system unit and?
The computer memory is, measured in?
If the output signal of any logic gate is fed into an inverter, the results is?    .

options.C: the inverse of the output signal
options.D: the same as the output signal

explanation: Logic Inverters are also known as NOT gates. It mainly inverts the bit. If input is logic 1 output will belogic 0and vice versa.

text: The device through which the main components of the computer communicate with each other is called?
explanation: The main components of the computer communicate with each other, through theSystem bus. The keyboard, Monitor, and Memory are the only things that USE the system bus to communicate with the CPU, etc.

text: The hardware of a computer does not consist of?
Output devices in a computer are those devices that send?

options.A: results to the memory of the computer
options.B: processed data and instructions into the computer
options.C: in data and instructions into the computer
options.D: data and instructions into the memory of the computer

explanation: Output devices in a computer are those devices that send results to the memory of the computer. They take information that the computer has processed and present it in a form that humans can understand.

text: The memory unit of the computer belongs to the?
explanation: The memory unit of the computer belongs to the system unit. The system unit, also known as the system chassis, is a box-like case housing the electronic components of a computer. These components include the central processing unit (CPU), memory, and other parts essential to the computer's operation.

text: Which of the following is not a function of the operating system?

options.B: Ensuring the proper functioning of hardware.                    .
options.C: Maintenance of directories in external storage.

text: An example of a specific purpose application package is the?
explanation: A specific purpose application package is software that is designed to carry out a particular task. A payroll program is an example of this, designed specifically to manage and process payroll. e.g. Justworks, Paycor. etc.

text: The operating system, translators and utility programs are examples of?
The first stage in program development is problem?
explanation: The first stage in program development is problem definition, where the problem to be solved is clearly identified and articulated.

text: A pictorial representation of program flow is referred to as?
An example of a programming language that uses mnemonic codes is?
explanation: Assembly language uses mnemonics to represent instructions. Writing in mnemonics is easier for programmers because they are usually brief representations of the commands. They are quicker to write than binary and it is easier to spot mistakes. In COBOL, mnemonics are not used in the traditional sense like in assembly language programming.

text: The use of satellite to transmit signal information to the earth is enabled with the use of?
explanation: GPS (Global Positioning System) is a satellite-based radio navigation system owned by the United States government and operated by the United States Space Force. It is one of the global navigation satellite systems (GNSS) that provides geolocation and time information to a GPS receiver anywhere on or near the Earth where there is an unobstructed line of sight to four or more GPS satellites.

text: .The line segment that describes the contents of the message when sending an e-mail is?
Which of the following networks covers the widest range?
explanation: A wide area network (WAN) is a large computer network that connects groups of computers over a large geographical area, such as a country, a continent, or even the entire world. WANs are often used by large businesses to connect their office networks; each office typically has its local area network or LAN, and these LANs connect via a WAN.

In order to get to the symbol dialog box in MS-Word click on the?
explanation: To get to the 'Symbol' dialog box,click on the insert menu and choose 'Symbol'.

text: Which of the following is not a network device?
Which of the following is a valid e-mail address?
explanation: An Email address must consist of 4 components:the username, @, the domain name, and the domain name identifier. If an email address is missing any of these components, it will be invalid, and there will be no inbox for messages. An example is waeconline@yahoo.co.uk

text: In word processing, an efficient way to move the second paragraph and place it after the fourth paragraph is?
Which of the following items changes shape depending on the task being performed?
The computer keyboard key(s) that a user presses to move to the beginning of a current line of text is/are the?
Data loss in a computer cannot be prevented by the use of?
explanation: Data loss is an incident where data is destroyed, deleted, corrupted, or made unreadable by users and software applications. this can be prevented through the following means:   antivirus and firewalls, system backup, etc. The use of a password cannot prevent data loss in a computer.

text: The shortcut command used in restarting a computer is?
The term bus' width in data transfer refers to the?

options.A: number of wires in the bus.
options.C: number of bits of information the RAM can send to the CPU at the same time.
options.D: number of wires in the bus that carry information to the processor at a time

explanation: The term 'bus width' in data transfer refers to the number of bits of information that can be sent to the CPU from the RAM simultaneously. This is because the bus is the main communication system that transfers data between computer components, such as the CPU and the RAM. The width of the bus determines how much data can be transferred at a time. The wider the bus, the more bits can be transferred simultaneously.

options.D: permits an individual to have access to another person's message.

text: Computer ethics are important because they?

options.B: regulate the privacy of messages only.
options.D: prevent copyright infringement on discretional basis.

explanation: Computer ethics are important because they address piracy and comportment issues. They guide how individuals should behave when using computers and the internet.

text: Which of the following is the main advantage of intellectual property right?
Which of the following statements is true of free software? It

options.D: is a licensed software with permission to copy freely.

text: In hexadecimal number system, B, D and F represent which of the following decimal numbers?
explanation: In the hexadecimal number system, B, D, and F represent 11, 13, and 15, in base 10 respectively.
